clinical_study.brief_title: Human Adipose Derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells for Critical Limb Ischemia (CLI) in Diabetic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Using Mesenchymal Stem Cells From Adipose Tissue (CeTMAd) as Cell Regeneration Therapy in Chronic Ischemic Syndrome of Lower Limbs in Diabetic Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Andalusian Initiative for Advanced Therapies - Fundación Pública Andaluza Progreso y Salud

clinical_study.source: Andalusian Initiative for Advanced Therapies - Fundación Pública Andaluza Progreso y Salud

brief_summary.textblock:
A prospective, multicenter, open, randomized, parallel-group controlled study for two levels of dose.
The study population will consist of 30 non-diabetic patients with critical chronic ischemia in at least one of the lower limbs (CLI) and without possibility of revascularization, from whom results can clinically be evaluable, of whom, 20 patients will be included in the experimental group (10 for each dose level) and 10 in the control group.
In each of the two dose levels to be used in the study, 15 patients will be included, who will be randomized to the experimental group or the control group according to a distribution 2:1 (2 patients in the experimental group and 1 in control group), thus at each dose level, we will have 10 patients in the experimental group (treated with mesenchymal cells of adipose tissue) and 5 patients in the control group (conventional treatment)

primary_outcome.measure: Angiographic assessment of neovasculogenesis (angiogenesis plus arteriogenesis)
primary_outcome.description: Target limb vascularization would be quantified by a dedicated software, MetaMorph® v.6.3, by using Angiogenesis Tube Formation application module. Neovasculogenesis would be the difference between vascularization at baseline and 6 months follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Major adverse event (death, target limb amputation)

secondary_outcome.measure: University of Texas Classification at target limb

arm_group.description: Group of low dose of Mesenchymal stem cells.
Group of mid dose of mesenchymal stem cells

intervention.intervention_name: Autologous adipose derived mesenchymal stem cells
intervention.description: Intra-arterial administration through a selective cannulation of target common femoral artery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes, type 1 or 2
- Critical Limb Ischemia (Rutherford Becker Class II,III or IV)of at least one limb.
- No options for target limb revascularization.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cancer antecedent in the last two years
- Current limb infection or limb gangrene

facility.name: CABIMER (Andalusian Center for Molecular Biology and Regenerative Medicine)
